title: Region bounded by y=2x and y=x^2

content.question:
Let R be the region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graphs of y = 2x and y = x2, as shown in the figure above.

(a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text:
Let R be the region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graphs of y = 2x and y = x2, as shown in the figure above.

(a) Find the area of R.
(b) The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, at each x the cross section perpendicular to the x-axis has area A(x) = sin(Ï€/2x). Find the volume of the solid.
(c) Another solid has the same base R. For this solid, the cross sections perpendicular to the y-axis are squares. Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression for the volume of the solid.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
